birds_desc: Birds are warm-blooded, egg-laying animals that have vertebrae, or a backbone.
cats_desc: Cats, are small, carnivorous (meat-eating) mammals, of the family Felidae.
chameleons_desc: Chameleons  are a distinctive and highly specialized clade of Old World lizards with 202 species.
cows_desc: Cows are large grazing animals with two-toed or cloven hooves and a four-chambered stomach.
dogs_desc: Dogs are domesticated mammals, not natural wild animals. They were originally bred from wolves.
monkeys_desc: Monkeys are tree-dwelling simians and they are intelligent, social animals.
penguins_desc: A penguin has a large head, short neck, and elongated body. The tail is short, and wedge-shaped.
pigs_desc: Pigs are stout-bodied, short-legged, with thick skin usually sparsely coated with short bristles.
rats_desc: The rat is a medium-sized rodent. Rats are omnivores, they eat lots of different types of food.
snakes_desc: Snakes are limbless reptiles with long, cylindrical bodies, lidless eyes, and a forked tongue.
squirrels_desc: Squirrels typically have slender bodies with bushy tails and large eyes.
